title: Has Chelsea's John Terry revealed a potential destination? | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 20 shares It could suggest that Terry is set to trade London for one of the vastly warmer cities of Portugal. He would not be the first icon of the game to make the switch to the Portuguese league, with Real Madrid's Iker Casillas moving to Porto in summer 2015. That said, there is little guarantee that Terry is learning Portuguese for the sake of a summer transfer. After all, Chelsea have a significant Brazilian contingent in their squad, which might just mean that Terry is looking to improve his communication with Diego Costa and David Luiz. But Terry has hinted at a move into management, so may be polishing his communication Alternatively, the veteran defender may be preparing for a career in management, something he regularly offers updates on on his social accounts. It would be a useful tool in any manager's locker to be able to communicate in Portuguese, which is the sixth most spoken language in the world. Terry might be hopeful of an appearance in the FA Cup this weekend after finding his time limited in the Premier League. Chelsea take on Wolves at Molineux on Saturday.
